note.p: Death: North Berwick, East Lothian (29 March 1935)
Education: University College, London. Hon MD (Berne and Groningen)

Career: Assistant Professor of Physiology, University College, London (1874-1883); Jodrell Professor of Physiology, University College, London (1883-1899); Professor of Physiology, University of Edinburgh (1899-1933); President, British Association (1912)
Authority: Death date from ON, DSB and DNB
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1932-1935 vol l pp 401-407, plate, by Leonard Hill
References: Stewart Richards, 'Conan Doyle's "Challenger" Unchampioned: William Rutherford, FRS (1839-99), and the Origins of Practical Physiology in Britain' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 193-217
